title: How does the consecutive detection work?
answer:
1. When your phone screen is off and your fingerprint is not recognized for the first time, your phone will vibrate. If the fingerprint unlock fails again, your phone will not vibrate.

2. If the screen is on and the fingerprint unlock fails for the first time, your phone will vibrate and a message will be displayed telling you that fingerprint mismatches and asking you to remove your finger or try again. Try again and if the fingerprint unlock fails again, your phone will not vibrate and no message will be displayed.

3. The test time duration is 3s. Your phone can continuously detect your fingerprint for 10 times. If the fingerprint unlock still fails, your phone will stop the detection.
